subject: Dog Sledding
Dogs
lead_paragraph: The defending champion Lance Mackey and his 14 dogs sailed up a hill as the first team in the Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race to pull into Ruby, Alaska, on the Yukon River, about 600 miles into the 1,100-mile race to Nome. Mackey arrived at 7:32 a.m. Friday, more than two and a half hours before the four-time winner Jeff King clocked in with his 16 dogs. For beating the field to the Yukon, Mackey, 37, was treated to the traditional seven-course gourmet feast and received $5,000 in $1 bills.
